body.p: Deletes a Greenplum Database system that was initialized using gpinitsystem.

section.title: Synopsis
section.codeblock:
gpdeletesystem [-d master_data_directory] [-B parallel_processes] [-f] [-l logfile_directory] [-D]
gpdeletesystem -?
gpdeletesystem -v

section.title: Description
section.p: The gpdeletesystem utility performs the following actions:

ul.li: Stop all postgres processes (the segment instances and master instance).
Move any backup files out of the master and segment data directories.
Make sure that Greenplum Database is running.
If you are currently in a segment data directory, change directory to another location. The utility fails with an error when run from within a segment data directory.

section.p: This utility will not uninstall the Greenplum Database software.

plentry.pd: Specifies the master host data directory. If this option is not specified, the setting for the environment variable MASTER_DATA_DIRECTORY is used. If this option is specified, it overrides any setting of MASTER_DATA_DIRECTORY. If master_data_directory cannot be determined, the utility returns an error.
The number of segments to delete in parallel. If not specified, the utility will start up to 60 parallel processes depending on how many segment instances it needs to delete.
Force a delete even if backup files are found in the data directories. The default is to not delete Greenplum Database instances if backup files are present.
The directory to write the log file. Defaults to ~/gpAdminLogs.
Displays the version, status, last updated date, and check sum of this utility.
